column1: If you normally wear glasses for reading, wear them for this test.
If you wear glasses or contact lenses for distance vision, wear them for the test.
Keep both eyes open and cover one eye with the palm of the hand.
If you wear glasses for reading, wear them for the test.

You need a well-lit area at least 10 feet long for the distance vision test, and the following: - Measuring tape or a yardstick - Eye charts - Tape or tacks to hang the eye charts on the wall - A pencil to record results - Another person to help (if possible) The vision chart needs to be tacked to the wall at eye level.
